name: Carbo vegetabilis
Relationship: Antidotes: Spirits Nitre; Camph.; Ambra; Arsenic.Complementary: Kali-carb.; Dros.Compare: Carboneum - Lamp black. (Spasms commencing in tongue, down trachea and extremities. Tingling sensation.) Lycop.; Ars.; China.

Stomach: Aversion to milk, meat, and FAT THINGS
Burning in stomach, extending to back and along spine
Distress comes on a half-hour after eating
Crampy pains forcing patient to bend double
Gastralgia of nursing women, with excessive flatulence
ERUCTATIONS, HEAVINESS, FULLNESS, AND SLEEPINESS; tense from flatulence, with pain; worse lying down
DIGESTION SLOW; FOOD PUTREFIES before it digests
Water brash, asthmatic breathing from flatulence
Faint gone feeling in stomach, not relieved by eating
CONTRACTIVE PAIN EXTENDING TO CHEST, WITH DISTENTION OF ABDOMEN
Female: Leucorrhoea before menses, thick, greenish, milky, excoriating
Premature and too copious menses; pale blood
Vulva swollen; aphthae; varies on pudenda
During menstruation, burning in hands and soles
Modalities: Worse: evening; night and open air; cold; from fat food
Abdomen: ABDOMEN GREATLY DISTENDED; better, passing wind
Pain as from lifting a weight; colic from riding in a carriage; excessive discharge of fetid flatus
Frequent, involuntary cadaverous-smelling stools, followed by burning
Cannot bear tight clothing around waist and abdomen
BLUISH, burning piles, PAIN after stool
Soreness, itching, moisture of perineum at night
Itching, gnawing and burning in rectum
Face: Pale, hippocratic, cold with cold sweat; blue
Respiratory: Spasmodic cough, bluish face, offensive expectoration, neglected pneumonia
Cough with itching in larynx; spasmodic with gagging and vomiting of mucus
Deep, rough voice, falling on slight exertion
Occasional spells of long coughing attacks
Wheezing and rattling of mucus in chest
ASTHMA IN AGED WITH BLUE SKIN
COUGH, WITH BURNING IN CHEST; worse in evening, in open air, after eating and talking
HOARSENESS; WORSE, EVENINGS, talking; evening oppression of breathing, sore and raw chest
Mouth: Blood oozing from gums when cleaning teeth
Teeth very sensitive where chewing; gums retracted and bleed easily
Tongue coated white or yellow brown, COVERED WITH APHTHAE
Nose: Coryza with cough, especially in moist, warm weather
Eruption in corner of alae nasi
Bleeding after straining, with pale face; tip of nose red and scabby, itching around nostrils
EPISTAXIS IN DAILY ATTACKS, WITH PALE FACE
Head: Vertigo with nausea and tinnitus
Head feels heavy, constricted
Pimples on forehead and face
Hair feels sore, FALLS OFF EASILY; scalp itches when getting warm in bed
ACHES FROM ANY OVER-INDULGENCE
Hat pressed upon head like a heavy weight
Skin: Moist skin; HOT PERSPIRATION; senile gangrene beginning in toes; bed sores; bleed easily
Itching; worse on evening, when warm in bed
Falling out of hair, from a general weakened condition
Ichorous, offensive discharge; tendency to gangrene of the margins
Extremities: Burning pain in bones and limbs
Heavy, stiff; feel paralyzed; LIMBS, GO TO SLEEP; want of muscular energy; joints weak
Cramp in soles; feet numb and sweaty
Male: Itching and moisture at thigh near scrotum
Discharge of prostatic fluid at stool
Ears: Malformation of cerumen with exfoliation of dermoid layer of meatus

details: Disintegration and IMPERFECT OXIDATION is the keynote of this remedy. The typical Carbo patient is sluggish, fat and lazy and has a tendency to chronicity in his complaints. Blood seems to stagnate in the capillaries, causing blueness, coldness, and ecchymosis. Body becomes blue, icy-cold. Bacteria find a rich soil in the nearly lifeless blood stream and sepsis and typhoidal state ensues. A lowered vital power from loss of fluids, after drugging; after other diseases; in old people with venous congestions; states of collapse in cholera, typhoid; these are some of the conditions offering special inducements to the action of Carbo veg. The patient may be almost lifeless, but the head is hot; coldness, breath cool, pulse imperceptible, oppressed and quickened respiration, and must have air, must be fanned hard, must have all the windows open. This is a typical state for Carbo veg. The patient faints easily, is worn out, and must have fresh air. Hemorrhage from any mucous surface. Very debilitated. Patient seems to be too weak to hold out. PERSONS WHO HAVE NEVER FULLY RECOVERED FROM THE EFFECTS OF SOME PREVIOUS ILLNESS. Sense of weight, as in the head (occiput), eyes and eyelids, before the ears, in the stomach, and elsewhere in the body; putrid (septic) condition of all its affections, coupled with a burning sensation. General venous stasis, bluish skin, limbs cold.
dosage: First to third trituration in stomach disorders. Thirtieth potency and higher in chronic conditions, and in collapse.
